Subject: Another ARC format wish item...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Just to get another wishlist item for an ARC revision into the record
for discussion:

Our current tools to read the ARC format expect just a single space
character between metadata-line fields.

If this were instead a whitespace-run, it would be possible to leave
excess space in the metadata-line, and start writing the record
without knowing its exact length. Then, go back to the metadata-line
and fill in the actual length when done.

(Such length-patching would be very difficult if the metadata-line is
within one of the compressed GZIP segments; however, metadata-lines could
be written to the file with a GZIP setting of "no compression",
allowing such random edits and possibly offering other random-seek
and index-reconstruction benefits.)

The benefit of writing to the ARC before the length is known would be to
reduce the need for temporary files -- and a redundant read/rewrite --
when resources exceed the size of the in-memory per-URI/thread buffers.

- Gordon
